sen.j: 高田石成（たかたのいわなり、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TAKATA no Iwanari was active in the Asuka period (his age at birth and age at death are unknown).
TAKATA no Iwanari (his age of birth and death are unkown) was from the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: age of は二回も必要ないです。
sen.e: TAKATA no Iwanari (his age of birth and death are unkown) was from the Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「たかたのいはなり」。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name had been written as TAKATA no Ihanari, and it is considered to have been pronounced as TAKATA no Ifanari.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥時代は、は行をFで発音していたので、Ifanariとなります。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name had been written as TAKATA no Ihanari, and it is considered to have been pronounced as TAKATA no Ifanari.
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name had been written as TAKATA no Ihanari, and it is considered to have been pronounced as TAKATA no Ifanari.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Obito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Obito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Obito.

sen.j: 3種類の武器に習熟したことによって、689年に持統天皇から賞を与えられた。
sen.e: Since he was good at using three kinds of weapon, in 689, he was given a prize by Empress Jito.
Since he was good at using three kinds of weapon, in 689, he was given a prize by Empress Jito.
Since he was good at using three kinds of weapon, in 689, he was given a prize by Empress Jito.

sen.j: 高田氏は渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: The Takata clan was one of immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Takata clan was one of immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Takata clan was one of immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 石成については『日本書紀』の持統天皇3年（689年）11月8日の条にのみ見える。
sen.e: The description about Iwanari is found in only the article of November 8, the third year of Empress Jito (year 689 in old lunar calendar) in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan).
The description about Iwanari is found in only the article of November 8, the third year of Empress Jito (year 689 in old lunar calendar) in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan).
The description about Iwanari is found in only the article of November 8, the third year of Empress Jito (year 689 in old lunar calendar) in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan).

sen.j: それによれば、追広弐の高田首石成は、中市において、三つの武器に習熟したことを褒められ物を与えられた。
sen.e: According to the article, at Ichinaka (considered to have indicated to the middle of the downtown), Tsuikoni TAKATA no Obito Iwanari was praised for perfecting himself in three weapons and given a prize.
sen.cmt: 中市Ichinaka…岩波文庫『日本書紀』に「いちなか」とあるのに従います。追広弐Tsuikoni
sen.e: According to the article, at Ichinaka (considered to have indicated to the middle of the downtown), Tsuikoni TAKATA no Obito Iwanari was praised for perfecting himself in three weapons and given a prize.

According to the article, at Ichinaka (considered to have indicated to the middle of the downtown), Tsuikoni TAKATA no Obito Iwanari was praised for perfecting himself in three weapons and given a prize.

sen.j: 追広弐は下級官人の官位である。
sen.e: Tsuikoni is a rank for lower officials.
Tsuikoni is a rank for lower officials.
Tsuikoni is a rank for lower officials.

sen.j: 官吏に武器の所有を義務付けることは天武天皇以来の政策であったが、特定個人の褒賞の記事は珍しい。
sen.e: Since the period of Emperor Tenmu, the officials had been obligated to bring weapons by imperial policy, however, such article which an emperor praised a particular official is rarely found.
Since the period of Emperor Tenmu, the officials had been obligated to bring weapons by imperial policy, however, such article which an emperor praised a particular official is rarely found.
Since the period of Emperor Tenmu, the officials had been obligated to bring weapons by imperial policy, however, such article which an emperor praised a particular official is rarely found.
